case_title: ROSHAN AND OTHERS vs RABIA BIBI AND OTHERS
complaint_summary: Petitioners alleged illegal allocation of their land (Killa Nos. 1, 2, 8, 9, and 10 of Sq. No. 243) to the father of the respondents during consolidation. They also claimed respondents filed a time-barred counter-appeal to acquire additional land.
investigation_summary: The Collector (Cons.) remanded the case to the Consolidation Officer for a spot visit and mutual compromise or submission of proposals for further consideration.
judgment_summary: The revision petition was dismissed as the order of the Collector (Cons.) was not final and the petitioners retained the right to present their viewpoint before the Consolidation Officer.
legal_arguments: Petitioners argued their land was illegally allocated to respondents' father.
Respondents filed a time-barred counter-appeal to acquire additional land.
Petitioners claimed the lower court orders were illegal and should be set aside.
key_issues: Illegal allocation of land during consolidation

legal_terms.Consolidation: The process of reorganizing land holdings to improve agricultural efficiency.
legal_terms.Khasra Numbers: Specific plot numbers used in land records.

words_and_phrases.Remand: To send back a case to a lower court or officer for further action.
words_and_phrases.Default: Failure to take action or appear in court.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves a property dispute over land consolidation. Petitioners alleged illegal allocation of their land to respondents' father and challenged the legality of lower court orders. The revision petition was dismissed as the Collector's order was not final, allowing petitioners to present their case before the Consolidation Officer.
